website_summaries.verdict: The BPA-free plastic design means it's unlikely this French press will shatter if dropped.
pros: An inexpensive option that brews robust coffee thanks to the flavor lock mechanism in the plunger
The plastic mesh allows for surprisingly fine grounds
cons: The plunger itself is flimsy and prone to breaking

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT from customer-service savvy company
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product from a customer-service savvy company. After suffering from too many glass French Presses which broke, I tried this one made from plastic. I was pleasantly surprised. Capacity enough for 2-3 large breakfast mugs. Easy to use. And if it cracks, which mine did after a great many months of almost daily use, call Bonjour customer service and --if my experience is typical-- they will replace.
customer_reviews.author: NY Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbreakable yes but the plunger is poorly designed. Leaves ...
customer_reviews.text: Unbreakable yes but the plunger is poorly designed. Leaves a lot of coffee behind that you cannot get out. Update dec 7 2017. Took me over a year to finally break it. Thank god! I hated the way this French press worked. It doesn’t have a large mesh surface to strain the grounds out of your coffee, rather a plastic piece with 6 small mesh holes. Required way more force to plunge than necessary. In the end, it was this piece that broke as the actual plastic body of the coffee press never failed. Spend a little extra and get a nicer one than this.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Nail

customer_reviews.title: Very nice....makes yummy coffee
customer_reviews.text: I bought one locally so already liked it. like That it is unbreable...sort of. I would not do well with glass. My only complaint is delivery was wwwaaaayyyyy long.....why?
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Preisler

customer_reviews.title: For several weeks, I made many a delicious little ...
customer_reviews.text: For several weeks, I made many a delicious little pot of coffee with this little beauty. At one point, I decided to take the plunger apart, to clean the small amount of grounds that had made their way into the inner workings of the filter assembly. Big mistake. Though I am 90% sure I put the 4 pieces of the filter together again in the proper order, it never really closed up and snapped back together, and now there are tons of grounds in it after every pot, forcing me to take it apart every time. Not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Baritone

customer_reviews.title: Clogs quickly, bottom filter only has small holes
customer_reviews.text: The main filter only has several small holes versus the typical french presses where the entire diameter of the part you push down is a filter. This makes it very hard to push down. In addition, there is a filter near where you porr that gets clogged quickly and all the time. You can' even pour the entire pot without it clogging to the point of it barely dripping out coffee. .
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoGold

customer_reviews.title: For the Coffee Connesseir
customer_reviews.text: If you love coffee then you really ought to have a French Press and learn to use it. Amirite, fellow coffee lovers? Several different styles exist. I have an older one by the same maker (BonJour) that I like a bit better. but I couldn't find an exact match. I made coffee for my dad with my French Press, and he immediately wanted his own. This is the version that comes closest to the one I already own (made years ago), and my dad just loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Solipsy

customer_reviews.title: Great plastic press
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee press for our new condo on the beach in Mexico. Since metal corrodes easily in salt air, plastic was necessary. I liked that it fit easily in my suitcase and was light weight. As far as using it, the coffee was rich and flavorful. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Reuling

customer_reviews.title: Not unbreakable.
customer_reviews.text: While the carafe might be unbreakable, the press (plunger) isn't! I used it for a few days (and had great results) but then the metal rod broke through to the plastic circle that does the plunging. And it's not like I was really leaning on it, just doing what you're supposed to. A real bummer, but the construction of this thing can't handle even the minimal pressure necessary to do its job. At least it was easy to get a refund through Amazon. Going to try a $40 Bodum now instead.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This Bonjour "Flavor lock" is not stainless steel and cannot be taken apart to clean, otherwise functions adequately
customer_reviews.text: - I did not know that the "flavor lock" on this unit is far different from the stainless-steel flavor lock that I have seen illustrated on other Bonjour French-Presses. This unit just has plastic flaps that flutter open when liquid is passing through, and these relax back against the mesh when there is no fluid flow. However, there is always a small opening through which the coffee grounds can extract [bitterness] into the finished chamber - I like the splash guard and extra strainer attached to the lid, although I wish the main screen-mesh had smaller openings - The filter, filter lock, and press-plate assemble cannot be taken apart to clean
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle King

customer_reviews.title: The worst press I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: About 5 years ago I purchased an unbreakable BonJour press. It was all right. Did the job. Eventually the screen plunger cracked necessitating its replacement. I went to the same brand for replacement. This is another case of fixing what ain't broke. It has some delusional stop brew technology that keeps the plunger approximately 2.5 inches from the bottom with a screen that amounts to 6 half inch holes with flaps that create one way valves. The sludge never settles to the bottom just lays on top of the plunger. I am going to wash it out and pack it away for back up.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Hollins

customer_reviews.title: Very nice coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: Love French press coffee but after shattering several thin glass carafes I decided to test this acrylic one. It works perfectly, makes an excellent 2 1/2 mugs of coffee to my tastes, and no concerns about breaking glass. That it is BPA-free is an added advantage. Cleans easily, no discoloration after making over 20 pots of coffee in it, and only wish I had purchased a larger model.
customer_reviews.author: Scifysponge

customer_reviews.title: The plunger plastic is poorly made and lets a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: The plunger plastic is poorly made and lets a lot of coffee grounds come through. Eventually the plunger came apart and I had to buy a new french press. I will be sure to always buy a press with a stainless steel plunger in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says it's going to do. I like plastic better than glass, I've had a lot of broken glass French presses.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Plastic changes color gets real nasty. Grinds always seep through heavily even with new screen on lid. Waste of money, poorly designed product. After 3 months I just gave up. Found a better "Made in Portugal" not Chinese french press at starbucks for $19 by bodum. Testing it out now, so far so good. Avoid this overpriced hunk of junk
customer_reviews.author: Aron

customer_reviews.title: Works great and very nice looking
customer_reviews.text: I know BonJour is a quality product and after receiving and using this item, I still have no doubts. Works great and very nice looking. Quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Dee D

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 2 weeks!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the press because our previous model was designed by the same company. Unfortunately our press broke within 2 weeks of receiving it! We will never purchase from this company again. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: You do not need to use nearly as much coffee as the instructions state (considering it's labeled as an 8-cup container, you'd think you'd need 8T coffee.) You really only get about 3-4 cups of coffee out of it, so just use about 4T coffee instead or else it's incredibly strong. Also, if you add one more scoop to what's left, you can get a decent second pot out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Freeman

customer_reviews.title: It is just the thing for hot coffee first thing in the morning in the great outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping. It is just the thing for hot coffee first thing in the morning in the great outdoors! !
customer_reviews.author: turkeypredator

customer_reviews.title: Crack in plastic after a few months
customer_reviews.text: It would be a great product if it was better quality. It has not been dropped and yet it has a big crack in the bottom (see picture). I also measure the temperature of my water for my coffee, so it is not being overheated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good and bad
customer_reviews.text: the clear plastic brewing part is great, truly unbreakable. the components(handle, plunger, lid) are total junk. if you break your glass cup, keep the parts from the old press, and swap in the plastic cup. that's what i did and it works great. best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: otbrenner

customer_reviews.title: Bought Again
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this excellent press. Always make consistently good coffee, with no grounds. If I ever need a third press, it will be the BonJour. I've recommended it to others. Very good price and delivery, too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mcclain

customer_reviews.title: Must have the good stuff...
customer_reviews.text: I hate the coffee in hotels(weak) & I hate not having coffee when I'm out on remote location, so this press solves that problem & no worries about glass breakage. Combine this with a electric kettle & you're golden! I found some airtight containers for coffee, sugar & cream...Caffeine fix satisfied anywhere & Life is good!
customer_reviews.author: LORDBADACTOR

customer_reviews.title: This is great
customer_reviews.text: it's exactly what i was looking for. plastic is great b/c it won't break. i use it almost every single day. it rinses out easily. my only minute (picky) complaint is that the coffee doesn't pour out super easily b/c the stopper is designed to filter out grinds. so basically the design is great for filtering out more grinds than the regular mesh stopper, but in exchange, i have to fiddle with it to get that last ounce of coffee out. i know, my life is so hard. ha. otherwise, this is a fantastic product especially for every day usage. i will admit, no i wouldn't get this one for aesthetics. this is functional.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Love the Titan plastic, unhappy with the filter lid
customer_reviews.text: The unbreakable titan plastic is excellent. Unfortunately for me the 'patented' filter lid started falling appart immediatly and completely destroyed itself within three weeks of use. I would buy a BonJour french press again, but I would avoid the patented filter lid. There is nothing wrong with the multipart filters that most french presses use; one peice is convenient in principle, but not if it doesn't last. Also, this thing is not 8 cups, unless you only drink 4 oz of coffee in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H.

customer_reviews.title: Plunger broke after a couple months daily use
customer_reviews.text: Plunger broke into pieces after a couple months daily use. Plastic failed.
customer_reviews.author: josh attkisson

customer_reviews.title: BonJour Ami-Matin French Coffee Press
customer_reviews.text: I find this works very well and the coffee I make in it tastes great!!! So far I have only used Tim Horton's course grind coffee. Eventually I will try a different brand I can buy locally (flavoured).
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Delisi

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!! Get it.
customer_reviews.text: Made it through seven African countries on an epic road trip @timbuctu.me Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin L.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few uses and it isn't worth the trouble to return it for a portion of my payment.
customer_reviews.text: I used it less than 10 times and the piece holding the plunger down melted and no it isn't useable. The return policy says I have to pay for shipping to return it and I will only receive a partial refund. This is the first time I have ever had any problems returning an item. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lucille

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Plunger
customer_reviews.text: The only things wrong with this press (and this, to me, is a big thing) is the plunger. The plunger basically has 6 small circular openings for the coffee/liquid to pass through as you pour it out. This causes a significant amount of coffee (well, relatively) to be trapped at the bottom, unable to reach any of the circular openings. If you're making a full press-worth of coffee (i.e., 24 or more ounces of coffee), it's really not a big deal. But I make only about 8oz per day, so the amount that gets trapped is a significant proportion of it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Finally, I don't have to spend more money in buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: achara b.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent product, excellent delivery time, I would re-order. Thanks for such good service/
customer_reviews.author: joseph genna

customer_reviews.title: Plunger too tight
customer_reviews.text: This pot is difficult to clean because it is exteremly hard to pull the plunger from the pot. It makes decent coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil B. Cole

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Choice!
customer_reviews.text: Everything went without a hitch: the French Press arrived quickly, was safely packaged, the product was in first-class shape and is performing to our greatest satisfaction. This size is the one to get if you want more than one big mug of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: gocats64

customer_reviews.title: French Press
customer_reviews.text: I use this press in the camper - great coffee and no chance of the pot getting broke.
customer_reviews.author: gram

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works just like it said it would. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: nicol

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well for backpacking and camping. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed using it until the bottom discs separated. Then I saw all of the trapped coffee dust. Will now look for a plastic "beaker" with a plunger that is made to be taken apart.
customer_reviews.author: nephilly Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 6 uses
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy plastic if you're an avid coffee drinker. If you plan on having more than one cup a day, get a metal one - but be sure it's strong and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jamila Ali

customer_reviews.title: pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.text: The filter broke off the tamping rod--maybe because I would tap it against the sink to knock off coffee grains--but still . . . pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Kinetochore

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: After 3 or 4 uses, the plunger fell apart as I was taking it out of the carafe, and will not screw back on.
customer_reviews.author: laq

customer_reviews.title: Don't be confused.
customer_reviews.text: Makes coffee. Cold-brewed too if you like it that way. Has nothing to do with foreign journalists. Or squishing Parisians.
customer_reviews.author: DrewMetz

customer_reviews.title: Like it, Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: While this french press is not of the quality of some high-end ones that are out there, for it's price, the BonJour Ami-Martin is a steal. I make great coffee in this thing and it shows no signs of aging after 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Ah, good coffee again.
customer_reviews.text: I had a french press with a glass container that bit the dust when I knocked it off the counter. Ordered the Bonjour after reading other customer reviews and have not regreted it. The unit looks nice and makes good coffee. There is nothing else that needs to be said.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: simple
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and clean and haven't had any problems with it yet. If you're ok with not having glass this is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Bower

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you, Bonjour, for this well-designed,unbreakable French Press! No more broken glass, no hassles with cleaning the parts. Thanks for facilitating my experience with these coffee makers! :)
customer_reviews.author: Florida Gulf'er

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a piece of s***
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of s***. It has suction from hell, so when you are pressing down on it, some grounds squeeze back up- or worse, it slips out from underneath you. The container has a crack on the top already, i've used it 4 times and have not put it in the dishwasher. The casing has a bubble on the front vertical segment. I want to throw it into the fires of Mordor.
customer_reviews.author: Misa

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: It works. I got it as a gift. The only thing I didnt like was the rubber ring, but it helped to make the taste more pure.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Schoch

customer_reviews.title: a good press
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent French press, it feels a little cheap and takes a little extra care when pushing the plunger down (to many reviews of it breaking). However the coffee tastes delicious and really is ground free with the extra screen in the lid!
customer_reviews.author: bryvo

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after one month!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2 of these, used one on our boat for one month and it leaks due to crack across base. Of course it has only been hand-washed in cool water as the boat has no dishwasher... The second one I've used at home for one month now, and exactly the same happened. My other coffee presses have lasted a good ten years and take a lot to break so this is a very poor result for "unbreakable".
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Thody

customer_reviews.title: fail
customer_reviews.text: really hard to press the plunger down (inexplicably), feels cheap, the filter/plunger piece broke off the top after about 10 uses. not worth investing in.
customer_reviews.author: Madelyne Greene

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Rather flimsy and cheap. During sencond use, the rubber bit around the strainer separated and coffee grounds came through. Then grounds were stuck in the filter part. Returned item and bought a real press from my local roasterie.
customer_reviews.author: merimermer

customer_reviews.title: Unbreakable...
customer_reviews.text: After accidentally breaking several glass presses I've decided to try this unbreakable one. It's already survived one fall off the counter so I guess it's paid for itself. The only problem I've encountered so far is the press has a rubber or silicone squeegie type plunger and it's no problem to press down. The issue is once the plunger is all the way down it takes a little more effort to reverse the direction of the squeegie when you want to pull the plunger out for cleaning. Other then this the press is great and hasn't broken once... yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sven

customer_reviews.title: Great press that performs better than more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.text: Really, really love this little travel press. Bought one of these a couple of years ago specifically because it was plastic and would not break in the suitcase. It has been to over 20 countries and performed flawlessly. Bought this one as a gift for my aunt after purchasing a more expensive glass one from Amazon that arrived shattered in pieces. She loves this and is super happy. This definitely gets a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Spooker

customer_reviews.title: Happy & Lifetime Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfectly fine little coffee press, but not sure how it would stand up to hard use. After 2 years of not-daily coffee making, we discovered that the inside plunger liner had cracked - radiating out from each of the six sides of the bolt that holds the plunger filter together. How sad! I called BonJour to find a replacement part & was instructed to send the whole item in for recycling & replacement at no charge. How nice is that?! I will be mailing it today, so can't report yet on the promptness of replacement, but am delighted that I may not have to buy a new french press after all.
customer_reviews.author: Jo C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased this product in August 2011, and within three months, the plunger cracked. I e-mailed BonJour(Pots & Pans.com) and they replaced the entire item. After only one month, that plunger also cracked and pieces started falling off of it. I e-mailed BonJour again and am still waiting for a response. I would not recommend this product because it is not durable under normal use. DL Update: BonJour sent me a new, upgraded French Press, hassle free, and I have been enjoying my coffee ever since!
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if you break the glass ones easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these back in 2011 and the plastic finally cracked today. For the past 5 years, it has gotten almost daily use and been through the dishwasher at least every couple days. I consider that a pretty good deal at this price. Is it the greatest French press ever made? No. But it's the best you'll find at this size that's not made of glass. And I am a klutz and can break a glass French press by looking at it wrong, so 5 years is a record for me. I was buying 1-2 new glass ones a year before that.
customer_reviews.author: SDInferno

customer_reviews.title: Great For Camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for camping and found that it works just as good as my glass one for the house. That said, I've only used it 6 times. Time will tell if it will hold up to being lugged around in a crate all summer.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Great product...for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.text: My wife got a French press for Christmas a couple years ago. I don't drink coffee with a French press, and didn't know what one was before she got hers...but I instantly saw an alternate use for one. I purchased this French press for lawn use. (My wife wouldn't let me use hers). There are some products/chemicals I use that come as solid granules/aggregate that require to be dissolved in water, then sprayed. When product doesn't COMPLETELY dissolve, they will clog sprayer tips. This press does a great job at keep random stragglers at bay and out of my tank!
customer_reviews.author: Hammbone

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This is only a camping item for us, so has seen maybe 4 total weeks of use in the last two years, but the filtering mechanism began to break right away and this time crumbled completely. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: alexis

customer_reviews.title: but the mechanics are pretty weak. The rubber used to keep the grinds ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, the beaker may be unbreakable, but the mechanics are pretty weak. The rubber used to keep the grinds from coming up on the sides of the filter/strainer is so tough that it creates way too much pressure and leads to a cracking of the generally cheap plastic that was used on the filter mechanism. Didn't last nearly as long as I was hoping. It's sad that it's so hard to find a reliable french press for under $60.
customer_reviews.author: BMore Andrew

customer_reviews.title: My favorite piece of camping gear!
customer_reviews.text: What a terrific way to start the day out on the trail...nice hot coffee made with an unbreakable french press. Well the llamas and I will probably figure out a way to break it sooner or later...but if and when we do...I'll buy another one right away. Great piece of gear!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Unbreakable Plastic French Press
customer_reviews.text: After several uses the plastic container began to show scratch marks from the filter rubbing inside when pressing the metal filter down
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee but has a little mesh at the lip ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee but has a little mesh at the lip to keep grounds from getting out which is great but when you're pouring the coffee and trying to get the last bit the grounds come up and cover the mesh making the pouring take a lot longer to get all the liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lamberts

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Works great but only lasted 7 months. This is my second and it lasted a year.
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a notorious history of breaking my French presses. It's terrible but when I saw this beauty I thought hey why not. It is so handy since I don't have to temper the container like my (former) glass ones so it's great! The spoon is super convenient. Overall it is a really great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nanie

customer_reviews.title: I use this less than once a week and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this less than once a week and the plastic piece that is part of the filtration has already snapped in half. I have yet to find a French Press that actually lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Piemanbcchs77

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I went through two separate glass pressed before I smartened up and looked for a plastic one. This one does the job well and so far has held up to my clumsy habits of dropping it or or tossing it in the sink.
customer_reviews.author: HarloweThrombey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We love the French Press coffee maker. Best coffee you can drink when you grind your own beans.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B.

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient.
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough, easy to clean, hasn't broken! It doesn't quite filter out all the grounds on a regular basis, so grind your own and make sure they are still pretty course, fine grounds will end up in your cup of joe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Love this non breakable French press
customer_reviews.text: Love this non breakable French press, just wish I could get a replacement plunger. It does break down after use.
customer_reviews.author: Kim M.

customer_reviews.title: Just as ordered - was a gift and is in daly use
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected from the other reviews, product looks and works great. Not too big and not too small three medium cups or two large.
customer_reviews.author: AAG

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I am going to get another, fast shipping great for work.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Nell

customer_reviews.title: Dud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a month ago for my cousin and it is now broken. The plastic on the plunger broke, her husband said it was likely that the plastic could not withstand the heat of the water. Find one with a metal plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Backman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: just a unit to make coffee - nothing positive or negative, it serves the purpose
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was tired of my glass ones breaking. The carafe didn't break, but the plunger broke after only a few months. Not worth the additional money, you're better off getting a cheaper glass one.
customer_reviews.author: Shyam

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of coffee or tea.
customer_reviews.text: Use it daily. Good for coffee and tea. Best coffee you can make at home. Easy to use and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Moore

customer_reviews.title: french press
customer_reviews.text: perfect for what i needed which was to have for car camping and using in hotels that dont have coffee machines never had a french press and im pretty happy with it....... thanks
customer_reviews.author: sugars

customer_reviews.title: and even dropped and has held up great so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our travel trailer. I wanted something that was durable but not willing to pay $75.00 for a stainless steel one. It was banged around, and even dropped and has held up great so far.
customer_reviews.author: crispy bacon

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter asked for a French Press coffee maker for her birthday; actually, she has asked for one several times now and this year I purchased the Bonjour BPA Free French Press and we are both extremely glad we did. This is an awesome coffee maker, easy to use and makes fantastic coffee. The price is right, I received it quickly (in time for my daughter's birthday) and it is made very well. It's a great product and I highly recommend it to anyone who loves a freshly brewed cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Doxies Mom

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after minimal use in my camper within a year.
customer_reviews.author: DQ

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my sister she said she liked it a lot and she recommends it to anyone who wants a french press and the price is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie Wiseman

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but doesn't slide up and down \as ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but doesn't slide up and down \as smoothly as the glass ones do, and it's a little bit more tricky to clean.
customer_reviews.author: LEVIA Health, LLC

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR TRAVEL
customer_reviews.text: I love a french coffee press. The plastic is safer, when I travel.
customer_reviews.author: AS from PA

customer_reviews.title: It is mediocre
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because our other coffee press broke. There are tons of coffee grounds that come through and it is really hard to press down. It still works, but I wouldn't recommend it. Spend a little more and get a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: N. DeFranco

customer_reviews.title: Broke before 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This product worked just fine until the base broke before 6 months... At first, about a month ago, the plunger started to separate, but today the whole assembly broke..the plastic just cracked. There are no children in the house to play with it.. and we are careful in our cleaning and hand wash only. Disapointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amy F.M.

customer_reviews.title: Product is not built to last
customer_reviews.text: This product, when it is intact, is great. We purchased two of these french presses. One cracked at the bottom of the caraffe and both of them had issues with the plunger. On one french press, the screw was over-torqued and the press cracked. There is no mechanism to prevent over-torque by hand tightening. The other french press we purchased we were careful not to over-torque, but on cleaning the press screw fell out, never to be found again. The press has a poorly designed screw that needs a mechanism to prevent overtorque and another mechanism to prevent the screw from backing out.
customer_reviews.author: Willenator

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Larousse French Press
customer_reviews.text: This french press is not the best looking, but after I broke my other one I decided it was time for an unbreakable press. This one is great and does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: In Afghanistan

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: From the first time I used it, the rubber gasket on the plunger seemed to be too tight. Ultimately, it caused the whole plunger to crack off its stem.
customer_reviews.author: A. Varner

customer_reviews.title: Only 33 ounces, not the 8 cups I'm used to
customer_reviews.text: Holds 33 ounces which is not 8 cups to me, who drinks a 4 ounce cup of coffee? I should have looked closer and did the math.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought it would be.  Please state ounces.
customer_reviews.text: Eight cups is the new four cups. It was much smaller than we expected. Only 32 ounces. Also, the plastic is very thin compared even to a Nalgene bottle. I do like the way the filter works, though; it keeps all the grounds out of your cup. I would have returned it if it wasnt' such a hassle to do so.
customer_reviews.author: BoulderGardener

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I have the 3cup (one lg cup) and this is the same just bigger (3 lg cups). the BPA free is great. Price is better then in stores. Best coffee I have ever had. and used no electricity.
customer_reviews.author: NewGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good for Indians (Filter coffee)
customer_reviews.text: Having stayed in the US for more than 3 years and being unsatisfied with the US coffee (which doesn't taste like the Indian coffee made using filters) and the instant coffees, this product was a blessing. It works on the reverse priciple of the Indian filter coffee technique and gives very strong coffee. Like this product and it is very affordable. Desi guys will love it:)
customer_reviews.author: Sharath

product_meta.title: BonJour Ami-Matin Unbreakable French Press Coffee Maker, for Traveling, Camping, Everyday Use, 8-Cup/33.8 Ounce, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackCreate a coffee café experience, enjoying flavorful gourmet beverages brewed in the BonJour Coffee Unbreakable Plastic French Press. This stylish 33.8-ounce press brews eight 4-ounce espresso-sized cups of coffee and is crafted from crystal-clear, unbreakable BPA-free Tritan plastic. A patented shut-off infuser integrated right into the plunger of the French coffee press halts the brewing process to lock in fresh-pressed flavor. Additionally, an ingenious filtering lid helps reduce sediment in cups of coffee and espresso-based drinks. The plastic French press is dishwasher safe for easy cleanup.
feature_bullets: DESIGNED TO LAST: Crafted from unbreakable BPA-free Tritan plastic with easy-pour spout and colorful frame and lid, this French press brews three 4-ounce espresso-sized cups of coffee
BREW TO YOUR TASTE: A patented shut-off infuser integrated into the stainless steel rod and silicone gasket plunger stops brewing process to lock in fresh-pressed flavor
CAPTURE IT ALL: Domed lid has built in filter to further reduce sediment in coffee and other hot beverages
EASY TO CLEAN: Plastic, BPA free French press is dishwasher safe for an easy cleanup
